snippet: Computer scientists were able to discover the names of roughly a third of the people who had asked that online links about themselves be taken down.
abstract: Bits blog; latest research by computer scientists reveals flaw in Europe's so-called right to be forgotten law, which gives individuals right to be removed from from online searches, casting doubts on law's success.
lead_paragraph: Computer scientists were able to discover the names of roughly a third of the people who had asked that online links about themselves be taken down.

headline.main: Researchers Uncover a Flaw in Europe’s Tough Privacy Rules
headline.print_headline: Researchers Uncover a Flaw in Europe’s Tough Online Privacy Rules
